perturbation.original_text: (h) The  Association is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of New York ("FHLBNY");  and the deposit accounts of the Association are insured by the FDIC up to the applicable  limits.  Upon  consummation of the Conversion, the  liquidation  account  for the  benefit  of  Eligible  Account  Holders  and Supplemental  Eligible  Account  Holders will be duly  established in accordance with the requirements of the Conversion Regulations.
perturbation.changed_text: (h) The  Association is a member of the Federal Home Loan Bank of New York ("FHLBNY"). Upon  consummation of the Conversion, the  liquidation  account  for the  benefit  of  Eligible  Account  Holders  and Supplemental  Eligible  Account  Holders will be duly  established in accordance with the requirements of the Conversion Regulations.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of 'and the deposit accounts of the Association are insured by the FDIC up to the applicable limits' omits a legally mandated consumer protection. FDIC insurance is a federal requirement for savings and loan associations; omitting this statement creates a legal risk.

perturbation.original_text: (m)  The  financial  statements  which  are  included  in  the Registration  Statement  and which are part of the  Offering  Prospectus  fairly present the financial  condition,  results of operations,  retained earnings and cash  flows of the  Association  at the  respective  dates  thereof  and for the respective  periods  covered  thereby,  and  comply  as to form in all  material respects with the applicable accounting  requirements of Title 12 of the Code of Federal  Regulations  and  generally  accepted  accounting  principles  ("GAAP") (including  those  requiring  the  recording of certain  assets at their current market value).  Such financial  statements have been prepared in accordance with generally  accepted  accounting  principles  consistently  applied  through  the periods  involved,  present  fairly in all  material  respects  the  information required to be stated therein and are consistent with the most recent  financial statements and other reports filed by the Association with the OTS and the FDIC, except  that  accounting   principles   employed  in  such  filings  conform  to requirements  of such  authorities  and not  necessarily  to generally  accepted accounting   principles.   The  other  financial,   statistical  and  pro  forma information and related notes included in the Offering Prospectus present fairly the  information  shown  therein  on a basis  consistent  with the  audited  and unaudited  financial  statements,  if any,  of the  Association  included in the Offering Prospectus,  and as to the pro forma adjustments,  the adjustments made therein have been properly applied on the basis described therein.
perturbation.changed_text: (m)  The  financial  statements  which  are  included  in  the Registration  Statement  and which are part of the  Offering  Prospectus  fairly present the financial  condition,  results of operations,  retained earnings and cash  flows of the  Association.  Such financial  statements may not have been prepared in accordance with generally  accepted  accounting  principles  consistently  applied  through  the periods  involved and may not present  fairly in all  material  respects  the  information required to be stated therein and may not be consistent with the most recent  financial statements and other reports filed by the Association with the OTS and the FDIC.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the assurance that the financial statements adhere to regulatory and accounting standards, increasing legal risk. Presenting potentially inaccurate or inconsistent financial information violates regulations requiring accurate financial disclosures.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Act of 1933, regulations pertaining to financial statement accuracy and compliance with GAAP

perturbation.original_text: (t) The  Association will maintain appropriate arrangements for depositing all funds received from persons mailing  subscriptions  for or orders to  purchase   Shares  in  the   Subscription   and  Public   Offerings   on  an interest-bearing  basis at the rate described in the Offering  Prospectus  until the Closing Date and satisfaction of all conditions  precedent to the release of the   Association's   obligation  to  refund  payments   received  from  persons subscribing for or ordering Shares in the  Subscription  and Public Offerings in accordance  with the  Plan as  described  in the  Offering  Prospectus  or until refunds  of such  funds  have  been  made to the  persons  entitled  thereto  or withdrawal  authorizations canceled in accordance with the Plan and as described in the Offering  Prospectus.  The Association  will maintain such records of all funds received to permit the funds of each  subscriber to be separately  insured by the FDIC (to the maximum extent  allowable) and to enable the  Association to make the  appropriate  refunds of such funds in the event that such  refunds are required to be made in accordance with the Plan and as described in the Offering Prospectus.
perturbation.changed_text: (t) The  Association will maintain appropriate arrangements for depositing all funds received from persons mailing  subscriptions  for or orders to  purchase   Shares  in  the   Subscription   and  Public   Offerings   on  an interest-bearing  basis at the rate described in the Offering  Prospectus  until the Closing Date. The Association  will maintain records of all funds received.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the requirement to separately insure each subscriber's funds with the FDIC and enable appropriate refunds violates consumer protection laws. It introduces risk as depositors might not receive full refunds if the conversion fails. This omission introduces legal risk by potentially violating federal banking regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Deposit Insurance Act, regulations regarding handling of subscription funds in conversion offerings
